title.narrative: Cyclone Idai Response Mozambique and Zimbabwe

description.narrative: Cyclone Idai struck southern Africa on 15 March causing widespread destruction across Mozambique, Zimbabwe and Malawi. In Mozambique, the Cylone Idai Flash appeal was launched on 26 March, seeking $281 million in assistance. There have been 446 deaths, 58,000 homes destroyed, and more than 500,000 hectares of crops destroyed. 1.85 million people in need of urgent assistance. In Zimbabwe the death toll is reported to be more than 150 people. At least 923 homes have been destroyed. Idai has exacerbated the existing drought-related humanitarian crisis in which 5.3 million people are in urgent need of humanitarian assistance. Australia has committed a total of $ $2.5 million in assistance for Mozambique and Zimbabwe comprising: $1.25 million to WFP operations in Zimbabwe; $0.75 million via an Australian Humanitarian Partnerships activation, and $0.5 million via the Australia Red Cross (to fund International Federation of the Red Cross activities).
